Info Gain¶

For computing the information gain, students must implement the entropy() and conditional_entropy() functions. Both of these functions are used by the info_gain() method to compute the information gain.

Assignment.entropy(X: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Computes the entropy of a variable X: H(X).

The entropy is defined as:

\[H(X) = - \sum_{i=1}^n p(x_i) \cdot \log_2 p(x_i)\]

where \(p(x_i)\) is the probability of observing \(x_i\).

Parameters

X (np.array of shape=(n_samples,)) – Observed samples for which to compute the entropy.

Returns

result – Entropy of X.

Return type

float

Assignment.conditional_entropy(X: numpy.ndarray, Y: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Computes the conditional entropy of a variable Y given the observation X: H(Y|X).

The conditional entropy is defined as:

\[H(Y|X) = - \sum_{x \in X, y \in Y} p(x, y) \cdot \log_2 \frac{p(x, y)}{p(x)}\]

where \(p(x)\) is the probability of observing \(x\) and \(p(x, y)\) is the joint probability, i.e. the probability of observing both \(x\) and \(y\) simultaneously.

Parameters

  • X (np.array of shape=(n_samples,)) – Observations X.

  • Y (np.array of shape=(n_samples,)) – Corresponding observation Y for which to compute the conditional entropy.

Returns

result – Conditional entropy of Y given observation X.

Return type

float

Assignment.info_gain(features: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Computes the information gain for a feature with respect to the labels.

Parameters

  • features (np.array of shape=(n_samples,)) – Feature for which to compute the information gain (X).

  • labels (np.array of shape=(n_samples,)) – Labels corresponding to features for which to compute the info gain (Y).

Returns

result – Information gain.

Return type

float

Visualisation methods¶

To compute the information gain for each feature extracted in your extract() function, we provide the show_info_gain() method.

Assignment.show_info_gain(bins: int = 20) → None¶

Shows the information gain for all computed features.

Parameters

bins (int, default=20) – Number of bins in which to catagorize each individual value.

Submitting¶

To submit the repair assignment, please use the following submit_repair() function.

Note

Please remember to submit both the submit_repair() function as well as the submit() function (see Submit) for the entire assignment.

Assignment.submit_repair(student_numbers: List[str], server: str = 'https://ml4sec.eemcs.utwente.nl/repair', debug: bool = False) → None¶

Submit your info gain implementation to the server to check if your computation is correct. The result will print whether you passed the repair or not.

Parameters

  • student_numbers (list) – List of all student numbers in the group as a string, e.g., ‘s1234567’. Please use your actual student numbers, we have build in checks to prevent fraud.

  • server (string, default=”https://ml4sec.eemcs.utwente.nl/repair”) – Address of server to submit assignment.

  • debug (boolean, default=False) – If True, prints the computed results
